docs.text: What is Stockfish? Stockfish is a very powerful chess engine that is open source. As of writing, Stockfish 13 is the most current version. Read more about it! stockfishchess.org A guide on how to install Arena Chess GUI with the Stockfish engine. Download the latest Arena Chess archive from here Download the latest Stockfish archive from here Extract both .zip files to places that you will remember Open Arena Chess and navigate to Engines > Install New Engine Navigate to (your filepath)\stockfish-13-win\stockfish-13-win\Windows and install stockfish_(numbers)_x64.exe You have now installed Stockfish 11 with Arena Chess GUI! Just don't go cheating, alright?

docs.text: A tutorial on how to use Checkpoint's cheat function. Hey! This guide is hosted at eiphax now This guide will walk you through how to use Checkpoint's cheat function. Sharkhive no longer works as it's primary feature has been merged into Checkpoint. This guide will allow us to use cheats using the Rosalina Menu. Required: Luma 9.1 or above. Checkpoint version 3.7.0 or above. If you do not have checkpoint or need to update it, you can download the latest .cia here . Obtaining Cheats Open Checkpoint. The icon is the black flag on your homescreen. Select the game you want to cheat on Press "Cheats" under Backup and Restore When you see the list of cheats, press Y to save all of them, then press B When prompted to store the cheat save file, press A You have aquired some cheats, now let's use them in game! Using them in game Open the Rosalina Menu by pressing L + down on the dpad + select Hover under the "Cheats..." menu and press A Select the cheats you want Press B until you're back in the game The cheats should be active. You're done! Troubleshooting Q: Checkpoint says "No available cheat codes for this title!" A: You'll need to add them manually. Consider this guide. Q: My cheats don't work/crash! A: Consider not using them. Q: My game isn't showing up! A: Make sure you have a save for the game. If you're sure you do hold B for a few seconds and the game should appear. Q: How do I cheat on DS Games? A: If you're have a cartridge of the game, consider Nitrohax . If you're using TwilightMenu++, download Cheats using the updater, then set TwilightMenu's skin to Acekard or R4. Go to the game you want to cheat on and press Y then press X. Enable the cheats you want and press X to save. Don't have TwilightMenu++? Consider this.

docs.text: Recording 3DS Gameplay with Citra and OBS Citra is a 3DS emulator that has seen very good development in recent years. Many games run well on Citra, and they have a higher quality image compared to the 3DS. OBS is a very versatile piece of software that will allow you to record/stream Citra (and other stuff). Prerequisites Note that this is more of an advanced guide for users who are tech savvy and want the best quality possible while recording their 3DS gameplay. If you don't want to go through all the following steps or quality doesn't matter to you, check out Snickerstream Citra OBS A 3DS with Custom Firmware A computer capable of emulating and recording. Getting Started Install OBS and Citra If your game hasn't been dumped yet, follow the dump guide. To dump DLC and Updates, look here. Once your game is dumped, transfer it to your computer via SD or FTP. The dumped game will be located in /gm9/out on your SD. Open Citra. If you have a .3DS file press File > Load File then select your .3DS file. If you have a .CIA, press File > Install CIA then select your .CIA file. Open your game that you want to record. Keep Citra open for the next steps. Recording Open OBS In the Sources window, press + to add a new source. Press Game Capture , and name the source whatever you want, then press OK. You should get brought to a screen that says Properties for your source. Press the box next to Mode and select Capture specific window . Next to where it says window, choose `[Citra-qt.exe]: Citra (version) | game). You should see your Citra window in OBS. You can resize the window by dragging it. Once its set to your liking, press Start Recording in OBS. You are done! Extras To view your recording, in OBS press File > Show Recordings . To transfer your 3DS save to Citra, check out this guide

docs.text: Make Skullgirls Mobile Easy with One Character. Skullgirls Mobile is a gacha game spinoff of "Skullgirls : Second Encore" released for the PS3/PS4, Xbox, Switch, and PC. In all reality, you shouldn't be playing this game seriously. If you have never played Second Encore, give it a try! How to win with Squigly Bio-Exorcist Squigly is a very strong character. With a special ability that drains the opponent's health while you're near them, the ability to revive, and regenerate health, Bio-Exorcist can absolutely demolish teams that are higher level than you. (And do it solo!) Battle Opera: Combo Finisher, bounces airborne opponents to the corner so it can be used to corner carry a bit. Stun-Locks opponents on the ground. You can charge while its active but its not true. Drag 'N' Bite: It says damage is low but it actually does quite a lot, use this to corner carry. Use Drag N Bite first, then use Silver Chord. Do not use this move if you don't have any charge left, or if you have one charge left use silver chord because it will not let you combo. The Silver Chord: If you have charge left, wait a second before attacking as it will let you drain more of the opponent's health. Can combo even if you don't have charge. Rage Of The Dragon: Unblockable super. Does a fair bit of damage. Stronger with charge. Opponent quickrises after you use it, so time to charge is small/not an option. Daisy Pusher: Unblockable super, allows you time to charge. Use daisy pusher immedietly after you end a combo, you will always have this built up because of Squigly's ungodly ability to build blockbuster super fast. You can use this move while the opponent is still getting up so you can safely land it without being hit. Explaining Squigly's Mechanics Squigly is a "charge" character. When you unlock her special ability, she gets the ability to charge up Leviathan twice. Some moves and supers become stronger and use up one charge, but not all of them (Battle Opera for example). When Squigly has charge, her auto-combos become longer, which is perfect for building a ton of meter and insuring that you will have a blockbuster or two ready every time you are done with a combo. Bio-Exorcist Bio-Exorcist allows Squigly to capitalize off of her charge more than she already can. For starters, if she has charge, she will survive a fatal blow by using her teammates health. More health per charge. If she has no charge, or her teammates are dead, she will not revive. Additionally, Squigly leaches life off of her opponent whenever they are close to eachother. This means that the opponent's health gets drained (Unscaled!) while in combo. Go ahead and try standing next to a training dummy, see how fast their health bar goes down. Squigly can only drain health when she has atleast one charge. Combos (Auto combo after launcher will be referred to as air) Without Charge Auto Combo > Silver Chord > Auto Combo > Launcher > Air > Battle Opera > Daisy Pusher In Corner: Auto Combo > Silver Chord > Auto Combo > Battle Opera (wait) > Auto Combo > Launcher > Air > Daisy Pusher With Charge Auto Combo > Drag 'N' Bite > Auto Combo > Silver Chord > Auto Combo > Launcher > Air > Battle Opera > Daisy Pusher In Corner: Auto Combo > Drag 'N' Bite > Auto Combo > Battle Opera (wait) > Auto Combo > Silver Chord > Auto Combo > Launcher > Air > Rage Of The Dragon > Daisy Pusher   Using Silver Chord after Battle Opera insures we can get more poison damage.
docs.title: Skullgirls Mobile is Easy!
